abstract: Microsoft contends that Google’s $3.1 billion deal to buy DoubleClick would hurt competition in the online advertising market.
snippet: Microsoft contends that Google’s $3.1 billion deal to buy DoubleClick would hurt competition in the online advertising market.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft, a veteran defendant of epic antitrust battles in the United States and Europe, is urging regulators to consider scuttling Google’s plan to buy DoubleClick, an online advertising company.

headline.main: Microsoft Urges Review of Google-DoubleClick Deal
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Urges Review of Google’s Bid for Ad Company

abstract: Is Microsoft‘s objection to Google‘s $3.1 billion deal for online advertising company DoubleClick just a case of sour grapes? Microsoft and AT&T, both veteran defendants of epic antitrust battles in the United States and Europe, is urging regulators to consider scuttling Google’s plan to buy DoubleClick.
lead_paragraph: Is Microsoft‘s objection to Google‘s $3.1 billion deal for online advertising company DoubleClick just a case of sour grapes? Microsoft and AT&T, both veteran defendants of epic antitrust battles in the United States and Europe, is urging regulators to consider scuttling Google’s plan to buy DoubleClick.

headline.main: Microsoft Urges Review of Google-DoubleClick Deal
